title: Instructional Design for Contextual and Decontextual Understanding of Fractional Operators

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Fraction Operations (Addition/Subtraction) and Integer Computation Comprehension
context.additional_context: Real-life problem-solving centered on social domain applications.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of calculating quantities using fractional operators (e.g., pizza distribution) with 80% accuracy.
Learners achieve a 75% or higher accuracy rate in applying fractional multiplication/division to decontextualized symbolic problems (e.g., 3 Ã— 2/5).
Learners complete tasks involving the representation or interpretation of fractional operation results as visual models (bar graphs/pie charts) at an 85% completion rate.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
